title: Juvenile among four nabbed for Haryana woman's gang-rape, her daughter's murder
content: The woman had an altercation with a neighbour, following which she was dragged to the dumpsite and gang-raped, an official said, adding her husband was not at home at the time of the incident

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Tamil Film Producers Council moves Madras High Court against FEFSI
content: Justice K. Kumaresh Babu orders notice, returnable by May 7, to FEFSI as well as 23 associations affiliated to it

title: Speaking in favour of Pakistan after Pahalgam killings not right, Pawan Kalyan warns Congress
content: ‘Kashmir is ours. Talking about terrorism for political gain is shameful. National unity and strong action is must to curb communal violence,’ the Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM said, without referring to any leader

title: SC mulls clubbing FIRs against Sharjeel Imam, transferring them to Delhi
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna remarked that all the cases arose from one speech and dealt with the same offence, saying that multiple and parallel trials would lead to ‘double jeopardy’

title: J&K student thrashed in Nagpur; students association seeks Fadnavis' intervention
content: J&K Students Association office-bearer Nasir Khuehami, who posted about it on his ‘X’ account and urged Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis to intervene in the matter.

title: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar hails new sensation from Bihar Vaibhav Suryavanshi; announces ₹10-lakh reward
content: “With his [Vaibhav Suryavanshi] hard work and talent, he has emerged as a new hope for Indian cricket. Everyone is proud of him,” Bihar CM Nitish Kumar praises the 14-year-old for T20 century

title: Minister Bharath urges Union Railway Minister to focus on rail connectivity  to industrial  nodes
content: The Minister urged the Railway Minister to approve at the earliest State government proposals for new railway lines and railway siding

title: "One-Way Traffic...": Javed Akhtar On Pak Artistes In India After J&K Attack
content: After last week's horrific terror attack in Pahalgam, in which 25 tourists and a Kashmiri ponywallah were killed, a movie featuring Pakistani actor Fawad Khan has not been allowed to release in India.

title: This Karnataka Family Visiting Pahalgam Was Saved By A Hair - Literally
content: Saved by a hair -- literally. That's what sums up the miraculous escape of the Hegdes, a Karnataka family visiting Pahalgam's Baisaran meadows on April 22, when terrorists murdered 25 tourists and a Kashmiri pony ride operator in cold blood.

title: Amit Shah To Rename Delhi Road After Bodo Leader Upendranath Brahma
content: In a significant tribute to Bodofa Upendranath Brahma's legacy, the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) would rename a stretch of Lala Lajpat Rai Marg in south Delhi to Bodofa Upendranath Brahma Marg, officials said.

title: Stock Markets Surge Amid Reports Of US's Tariff Relief To Automakers
content: Stock markets advanced on Tuesday following news that Donald Trump plans to spare automakers from some of his wide-ranging tariffs, boosting hopes of a less combative approach to his trade war.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Politicking Over Pahalgam
content: The party's exhortation to its leaders to adhere to the CWC resolution on the Pahalgam attack seems somewhat ironic. The underlying intent, however, appears to be laying the groundwork for a special Parliament session to discuss the attack.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Updates: Key Security Meet Begins At PM Modi's Residence
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is chairing a high-level meet at his Delhi residence - to review the ongoing fallout of last week's Pahalgam terror attack and the security situation in Jammu and Kashmir. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and NSA.

title: "It's Over": Canada's New PM Mark Carney Shows The Door To Donald Trump
content: In his victory speech after winning a stupendous electoral battle, where his Liberal Party came from behind to win the parliamentary election in Canada for a third consecutive time, Mark Carney, set to continue as PM, flayed Donald Trump.

title: "Even If The Storm Comes, We Say Allahu Akbar": J&K Zipline Operator's Father
content: The family of Muzamil, a zipline operator accused of shouting "Allahu Akbar" during the Pahalgam terror attack, has defended their son.

title: Canada Election Results LIVE: After Liberals' Victory, Mark Carney Says Old Relationship With US 'Is Over'
content: Canada Election Results 2025 LIVE Updates:Prime Minister Mark Carney-led Liberal party won Canada's election on Monday, according to local media projections.

title: Shaurya Chakra Awardee's Mother Among Pakistanis Being Deported From J&K
content: Authorities in Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday have set the ball rolling for the deportation of 60 Pakistanis, one of them the mother of Shaurya Chakra awardee who was killed in a terror attack, officials said.

title: Spain's Grid Operator Rules Out Cyberattack As Cause Of Sweeping Blackout
content: Spain's grid operator on Tuesday ruled out a cyberattack as the cause of a sweeping blackout that sparked chaos for millions of people across the Iberian Peninsula the previous day.

title: "Leave India": Pawan Kalyan Takes On Congress Over Pak, Indus Comments
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan has attacked the Congress over the comments of a section of its leaders on Pakistan.

title: "Knocked Down, Slapped 8-9 Times": J&K Student Thrashed In Nagpur
content: A student from Jammu and Kashmir studying at a pharmacy college in Nagpur was thrashed by a group of local residents, police said on Tuesday.

title: Drive launched to raze illegal settlements in Ahmedabad locality post detention of Bangladeshis
content: Ahmedabad authorities launch mega demolition drive to clear illegal constructions around Chandola Lake, targeting Bangladeshi immigrants

title: AHINDA groups launch letter campaign, urge Rahul Gandhi to caution Congress legislators opposing caste census report in Karnataka
content: Pointing out that AHINDA communities are the backbone of the Congress party support base in Karnataka, they have reminded Rahul Gandhi that the party, in its manifesto, promised to implement the caste census across India

title: Supreme Courts orders CBI probe into Supertech builder projects, cites ‘builder-bank nexus’
content: The apex court previously said thousands of homebuyers were affected by the subvention scheme, where banks paid 60 to 70% of the home loan amount to the builders without projects being completed within the stipulated time

title: Delhi Cabinet approves Bill to regulate fee in government, private schools
content: Education Minister Ashish Sood said that the Bill proposes formation of a three-tier committees to regulate fee hikes

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Union Home Secretary chairs high-level security meeting
content: Those present in the meeting include Union Home Secretary Govind Mohan; Director Generals of Border Security Force, Assam Rifles and National Security Guard; and senior officials of Central Reserve Police Force and the Central Industrial Security Force.

title: 'India would be one of first trade deals we sign': U.S. Treasury Secretary
content: Negotiations with our Asian trading partners are going very well. Vice President (JD) Vance was in India last week and talked about substantial progress, says U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent

title: Congress asks what steps govt is taking to secure BSF jawan's safe return
content: Pakistan Rangers detain BSF Constable Purnam Sahu near Punjab border, family awaits government action for safe return

title: CCPA issues notices to five restaurants for charging service fee despite court ruling
content: According to guidelines issued by the CCPA on July 4, 2022, and upheld by the Delhi High Court on March 28, 2025, restaurants cannot add service charges automatically to food bills or collect them under any other name.

title: Why interfering in academic affairs, leave it to experts: SC to BCI
content: A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and N. Kotiswar Singh was hearing pleas challenging the BCI's 2021 decision to scrap the one-year LLM course in the country and de-recognise foreign LLMs

title: Director Bhaskhar Maurya: ‘Muthayya’ was born out of my fear
content: As his debut Telugu indie feature gears up to stream on ETV Win, director Bhaskhar Maurya talks about ‘Muthayya’ being fuelled by his journey and observations

title: Kandula Durgesh tasked with overseeing display of Buddha’s relics in Vietnam
content: The relics will be dispatched from New Delhi on May 1, with the exhibition scheduled to continue in Vietnam until May 6

title: Three workers die after falling from a building at a construction site in Tirupati
content: Tirupati District Collector S. Venkateswar directs police to file a case against the building owner, suspends Panchayat Secretary and issues show-cause notice to EO (Panchayat Raj & Rural Development)

title: Power Back In Spain, Portugal After Crippling Blackout
content: Spain and Portugal recovered their electricity supply and a semblance of normalcy on Tuesday after a crippling blackout of unknown causes that disrupted daily life for millions.

title: 22 Killed As Massive Fire Engulfs China Restaurant
content: A restaurant fire in northeastern China killed 22 people and injured three on Tuesday, Beijing's state media said, with footage posted online showing fierce flames engulfing the building.

title: Russia Says Waiting For Ukraine's Response On Offer Of Direct Peace Talk
content: The Kremlin said on Tuesday that Ukraine had not responded to many offers by Russia President Vladimir Putin to start direct peace negotiations, and that it was unclear whether it would join a three-day ceasefire he has announced for next month.

title: Pak-Based Hackers Target Army Public Schools, Other Indian Sites
content: The provocation continues. Attempts to hack Indian websites by Pakistan-based cyber actors are on the rise since last week's Pahalgam terror attack that claimed 26 lives, the deadliest attack on civilians in Jammu and Kashmir in decades.

title: Trump Admin Probes "Race-Based Discrimination" At Harvard University
content: US President Donald Trump's administration said it has launched a probe into Harvard University and Harvard Law Review for "race-based discrimination" after receiving reports about the prestigious legal journal's selection process for articles.

title: Supreme Court Orders CBI Probe Into Builder-Bank Nexus In Delhi-NCR, Mumbai
content: Cracking down on delays in the construction of residences, the Supreme Court has ordered a CBI probe into a "nexus" between builders and banks in projects in Delhi, National Capital Region (NCR), Mumbai, Chandigarh, Mohali and Kolkata.

title: Prepare comprehensive plan for Miss World 2025: Telangana CM
content: Mr. Revanth Reddy wants adequate security arrangements at the airport, hotels where the participants were expected to stay

title: Producers’ Association president and secretary among four charged with sexual harassment on complaint by actor-producer Sandra Thomas
content: The Central police registered the case based on Ms. Thomas’s complaint about the alleged ill treatment meted out to her at the Producer’s Association office.

title: Karnataka High Court directs Union Government to block Switzerland-based Proton Mail in India
content: Court also orders immediate blocking of offending URLs of Proton Mail till action is initiated for blocking mail in India

title: Madras High Court refuses to recall order on CBI probe against ex-AIADMK Minister Rajenthra Bhalaji
content: Justice P. Velmurugan rejects the recall petition after taking note that the prosecution had already approached the Supreme Court challenging the High Court’s order

title: India at U.N.: Pakistan Defence Minister's open confession exposes country as 'rogue state' fuelling global terrorism
content: India accuses Pakistan of being ‘rogue state’ and supporting terrorism; global leaders condemn Pahalgam terror attack, support victims’ rights

title: BJP slams Congress for 'sar tan se juda' imagery aimed at Prime Minister Modi
content: Congress portrays PM Modi as missing during crisis in post on X; BJP accuses Congress of using divisive imagery to appease Muslims

title: Bodies of father and two children found in car submerged in Visvesvaraya canal in Mandya
content: Police said the man and his two children had called his family members in K. R. Nagar on April 17, informing them that they would be visiting KRS reservoir before heading to their native place

title: EAC defers clearance for Anakkampoyil-Meppadi tunnel road project
content: Cites proximity of the alignment to Chooralmala and Puthumala that faced landslides in the recent past

title: Police may arrest Periyar University V-C if he fails to cooperate with SC/ST case probe: Madras High Court
content: Justice P. Velmurugan affirms a judicial magistrate’s 2023 order refusing to remand the vice-chancellor but sets aside the grant of bail

title: Union Cabinet to meet on April 30, first since Pahalgam attack
content: The meeting under the chairmanship of Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be convened at 11 a.m. on Wednesday, April 30

title: Supreme Court asks what’s wrong if country using Pegasus against ‘anti-nationals’, agrees to examine if private citizens were hacked
content: The observation from the court came after senior advocate Dinesh Dwivedi said the “basic question” in this litigation was whether or not the government possessed Pegasus, and if it was used to conduct illegal surveillance on private citizens, including journalists and judges.

title: IIT Madras-led research team develops biosensor for pre-eclampsia testing in pregnant women
content: The low-cost diagnostic test has the potential to be used to detect other diseases such as cancer and Alzheimer’s, say researchers

title: Parliament security breach: High Court to hear bail plea of accused on May 7
content: Earlier, the High Court had asked the police to explain whether carrying or using a smoke canister, which is not lethal, is covered under the stringent Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) for the offence of terrorist activities.

title: Supreme Court refuses to entertain fresh pleas challenging Waqf (Amendment) Act
content: Supreme Court refuses more petitions challenging Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025, sets May 5 for preliminary objections and interim order

title: Rapper Vedan booked for wildlife hunting among other charges
content: He was arrested on non-bailable charges by a team of forest officials led by the Kodanad Range Officer immediately after he was released on bail by the Hill Palace in Kochi City following his arrest, along with eight of his friends

title: Ratan Tata: a life in innovation and enterprise
content: A series of essays and rare photographs of the astute businessman, pioneering philanthropist, nation builder and animal lover

title: Blinkit workers in Varanasi go on strike over fair pay and heat safety measures
content: The GIPSWU union claimed that Blinkit management blocked the IDs of around 150 workers, due to their strike

title: 50-year-old pourakarmika on her way to work killed by a speeding truck in Bengaluru
content: The deceased, Saroja, working on a Direct Payment System (DPS) with the BBMP, was going to be made a permanent employee of the civic body on May 1, 2025.

title: Girl gang raped, three held in Ranchi
content: The incident took place a few days back under the Namkum police station area, but the father of the victim lodged an FIR on Sunday (April 27, 2025)

title: Indian student missing in Canada for three days found dead
content: Vanshika went missing on April 25, after leaving her residence to view a rental room, according to a social media post by an Indo-Canadian association linked by the High Commission.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Tourist's video of zipline ride captures moment of attack
content: The 53-second video, shot using a selfie stick, showed people running for their lives, with one of them falling, apparently after being gunned down by a terrorist.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: 48 tourist sites in Kashmir shut amid security concerns
content: Gates have been closed at 48 of the 87 public parks and gardens in Kashmir in view of the threat perception to tourists

title: Odisha university punishes 100 students for indiscipline
content: While Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology in Burla has fined many between ₹1,000 and ₹5,000 for various acts of indiscipline, the harshest punishment includes reduction of one grade in theory subjects and conversion of pass grades to fail grades

title: Supreme Court declines bail to expelled Gujarat IPS officer Sanjiv Bhat
content: Senior Advocates Kapil Sibal, appearing for Sanjiv Bhatt, had contended that the cause of death was linked to pre-existing medical conditions, not police action.

title: ‘Neither country can afford a war; it is not just the last option but the last bad option’, says A.S. Dulat
content: Former RAW chief Amarjit Singh Dulat says it is important to keep the local Kashmiri happy and ‘on our side’

title: Maharashtra to establish ‘Tourism Security Force’ at popular destinations
content: The ‘Maharashtra Tourism Security Force’ will be started on a pilot basis during the Mahabaleshwar festival in Satara

title: Wanted Uttar Pradesh criminal carrying ₹1 lakh reward killed in police encounter
content: Murder suspect with ₹1 lakh reward killed in police encounter, weapons seized, multiple criminal cases registered against him

title: Rajasthan MLA urges PM to rescind order on deporting Pakistani refugees
content: Ravindra Singh Bhati, Independent MLA, seeks special rehabilitation for refugees living in India; he said many of them fled Pakistan because of religious persecution

title: SHRC recommends compensation to Arappor Iyakkam convenor in case of police excess
content: The case involved the unlawful detention of 11 volunteers of the non-governmental organisation by the Taramani police in July 2019

title: Vaccine fails to save Peruvallur girl mauled by stray dog a month ago
content: The girl, Ziya Faris from Peruvallur near Calicut University in the district, was mauled by the dog on March 29 when she stepped out of her house to get some sweets

title: Madras University journalism department examination row: High Court-ordered inquiry vindicates student
content: Senior Counsel A.K. Sriram files his inquiry report stating that an exam was indeed conducted on May 11, 2024, as claimed by the student and that a question paper produced by her in court is also genuine

title: 60 hi-tech community toilets for women to come up in Bidar district in Karnataka
content: They feature a waste conversion system for fertiliser production and an inverter system for safe and convenient use even at night

title: Pahalgam attack: “Representatives of people should show their unity,” says Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge urges PM Modi to convene special Parliament session to discuss Pahalgam terror attack

title: Kalaburagi corporation fails to pay salaries to employees for February and March
content: Salaries of outsourced employees have not been paid for three months as the civic body is facing a financial crisis

title: Major blaze at electronics goods showroom building in Mumbai; NDRF called in for firefighting ops
content: While no injuries have been reported at the site in Bandra, the building adjacent to the affected structure was vacated as a precautionary measure

title: Solidarity in wake of Pahalgam attack testimony to international community’s zero tolerance for terrorism: India
content: Last week, the 15-nation UN Security Council issued a Press Statement condemning “in the strongest terms” the terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir

title: Role in a risk society: how women bear a disproportionate burden
content: Coined by Ulrich Beck in his book ‘Risk Society: Towards a New Modernity’, the term ‘risk society’ describes a shift from an industrial society to one increasingly shaped by uncertainty and hazards created by technological and environmental developments

title: Pahalgam attack LIVE: PM Modi chairs meet with Rajnath, Doval, chiefs of three services
content: Pakistan Defence Minister’s open confession exposes country as ‘rogue state’ fuelling global terrorism, says India at U.N.

title: Kerala CM terms Shaji N. Karun an icon of world cinema
content: In a condolence message, Mr. Vijayan said Mr. Karun’s works brought national and international repute to Malayalam cinema.

title: A.P. issues comprehensive guidelines for urban local bodies on fund utilisation
content: Municipalities have been directed to allocate a minimum 20% to 30% of their revenues to capital expenditure projects; not less than 30% of income, excluding government grants, must be earmarked for public health advancements

title: All snakebite deaths in Karnataka will now be audited at district level
content: Snakebite envenoming is a neglected tropical disease (NTD) caused by the bite of a venomous snake, which are usually accidental in nature.

title: NDA govt. using SIT as political tool in liquor case, allege YSRCP leader
content: The case originated merely from letters sent by an unknown individual, “Venkateswara Srinivas,” with no proven connection to the liquor trade.

title: He taught us to go the extra distance in capturing a frame: Sunny Joseph on Shaji N.Karun
content: Veteran cinematographers like him instilled the courage in the people who followed them to take a few risks and go the extra distance in capturing a frame.

title: Female Tribal Students to participate in long march for not receiving accommodation in govt hostels
content: Student Federation of India (SFI) held several discussions with the tribal department for the accommodation of these girls in government hostels.

title: Maharashtra Congress alleges irregularities in MHT-CET State exams, writes to CM to seek a probe
content: Maharashtra Congress State president Harshvardhan Sapkal wrote a letter to Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis demanding investigation in the alleged irregularities in the State-level common entrance examination.

title: 49ers' Kittle: Signed 4-year, $76.4M extension
content: Tight end George Kittle, who was entering the final year of a deal he signed in 2020 with the 49ers, said Tuesday on the "Bussin' With The Boys" podcast that he signed a four-year, $76.4 million extension.

title: Ailing Butler delivers in 'winning time' for Warriors
content: Golden State's Jimmy Butler, playing through an injured tailbone, returned from a one-game absence to put his team one win away from advancing to the Western Conference semifinals.

title: Cavs humble Heat, set records in lopsided sweep
content: The Cavaliers finished off the most lopsided series in NBA history with a 138-83 win over Miami in Game 4.

title: Source: WR Johnson to Browns after strange '24
content: The Browns reached agreement on a one-year contract with free agent wide receiver Diontae Johnson on Monday.

title: No charges for man over hockey player's death
content: British prosecutors said Tuesday no charges will be brought against a man arrested on suspicion of manslaughter following the death of ice hockey player Adam Johnson in 2023.

title: Dept. of Ed.: Penn violated law with trans swimmer
content: The Trump administration said Monday that the University of Pennsylvania violated Title IX by letting a transgender swimmer compete on the school's women's team and into team facilities.

title: NBA says Doncic was fouled late in Lakers' G4 loss
content: Referees missed the Lakers' Luka Doncic getting fouled with 33 seconds left in Game 4 of their playoff series against the Timberwolves, the NBA said Monday.

title: Sources: Shaq agrees to be Sac State's hoops GM
content: Shaquille O'Neal has agreed to become the men's basketball general manager of Sacramento State, sources told ESPN.

title: 32 teams, 32 questions, 32 answers: Taking stock of what's ahead this offseason
content: The 2025 draft is over, but can the rookies make an impact? We answer lingering questions for all 32 teams.

title: 'That place is a nightmare': 30 years of Coors Field pitching horror stories
content: For three decades, baseball at the Rockies' park has bruised ERAs and egos. Here's what it's like on MLB's scariest mound.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Will Maple Leafs and Hurricanes move on to Round 2?
content: Tuesday may be the end for the Sens and Devils, while pivotal Games 5 transpire in Wild-Knights, Oilers-Kings.

title: 'We say Allahu Akbar even in storms': Pahalgam zipline operator’s father
content: Amidst the Pahalgam terror attack probe, zipline operator Muzammil's father defended his son's 'Allahu Akbar' shout, calling it a natural expression of faith. A Gujarat tourist alleged Muzammil uttered the phrase thrice before the firing. The video of the incident went viral, adding controversy to the investigation of the attack that killed 26 tourists.

title: 'Big goals, limited time': Did PM Modi hint at plan to avenge Pahalgam?
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, PM Narendra Modi assures a strong response. He emphasizes India's resolve to combat cross-border terrorism. Modi pledges justice for the victims and vows to punish the perpetrators. He reiterates the nation's commitment to identifying, tracking, and punishing terrorists and their supporters. The Prime Minister assures the world that India will not be broken by terrorism.

title: China’s Xi Jinping sends message to tech cos as DeepSeek seen as US security threat
content: President Xi Jinping has declared AI a strategic priority, urging China to lead in this transformative field. China aims for self-reliance in AI, balancing innovation with safety. Despite progress, concerns arise over data privacy and potential military applications, particularly with AI models like DeepSeek. Amidst U.S.

title: '#FantasticTea': Afridi to Dhawan's 'Kargil mein bhi haraya tha' remark
content: Shahid Afridi's sarcastic response to Shikhar Dhawan's criticism has ignited a social media firestorm. Dhawan slammed Afridi for blaming the Indian Army for the Pahalgam terror attack, leading to a sharp retort. Afridi's '#FantasticTea' comment references the 2019 Abhinandan Varthaman incident, stirring sensitive national sentiments. The exchange has escalated into a heated war of words between the two cricketing icons.

title: Soiled, or damaged currency notes? Check RBI guidelines for exchange
content: The Reserve Bank of India has established guidelines for exchanging damaged currency notes, ensuring that individuals don't face financial losses due to soiled, mutilated, or severely damaged notes. Banks are mandated to accept these notes, with refunds depending on the extent of the damage, and severely damaged notes require RBI evaluation.

title: Uber cancels WFH, CEO tells employees: "Good is not going to be ..."
content: Uber mandates a return to office for all employees, ending previous work-from-home arrangements. CEO Dara Khosrowshahi cites the need for higher performance standards and in-person collaboration to drive better results. Effective July 1, the policy requires employees to be in the office full-time, with limited exceptions granted through a rigorous approval process.

title: Big IPL records in RR vs GT clash overshadowed by Suryavanshi's knock
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy, stunned the IPL with a record-breaking 38-ball 101, leading Rajasthan Royals to a dominant victory over Gujarat Titans. His 35-ball century, the fastest by an Indian in IPL history, highlighted an evening of shattered records, including the highest partnership for Rajasthan Royals and the fastest 200+ run chase in IPL history.

title: 'Unholy builder-bank nexus': SC orders CBI probe into Supertech projects
content: The Supreme Court has instructed the CBI to launch seven preliminary investigations into suspected collusion between major banks and real estate developers across several Indian cities. This action aims to protect defrauded homebuyers in areas like Noida, Gurugram, and Mumbai. The court noted evidence suggesting a nexus between financial institutions and builders, leading to financial exploitation.

title: Pratika Rawal breaks 28-year-old record, becomes fastest to ...
content: India's Pratika Rawal has shattered records, becoming the fastest woman to reach 500 ODI runs in just eight innings, surpassing Charlotte Edwards' previous record. During the tri-series in Sri Lanka, Rawal's impressive 78-run innings against South Africa cemented her achievement. With 572 runs at an average of 81.71, she's now second-fastest overall, only behind Janneman Malan.

title: Europe firm shares Ozempic drug advisory that Musk captioned his Xmas photo on
content: The US Food and Drug Administration seized fake Ozempic injections. This happened on April 9, 2025. Novo Nordisk warned about these fake drugs. Elon Musk mentioned using a similar drug. The FDA is investigating the seized injections. Novo Nordisk won a legal battle against knockoff versions. They are emphasizing patient safety. Musk's post highlighted the mainstream use of weight-loss drugs.

title: Pahalgam attack: Pakistani terrorist a former para commando, finds probe
content: Investigations reveal Hashim Musa, the Pakistani terrorist behind the Pahalgam massacre, is a former para commando from Pakistan's special forces. Sources indicate Musa, now with LeT, was deployed to J&K to target non-locals and security forces.

title: 'Complete collapse of the system': Spanish PM on massive blackout across Europe
content: A massive power outage plunged Spain, Portugal, France, and Belgium into chaos on Monday, disrupting transport and daily life. Millions were affected as trains halted, flights were grounded, and mobile signals went down. Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez described it as an unprecedented “complete collapse,” with Spain losing 60% of its national energy demand in seconds.

title: 'There's really no plan': How the self alley-oop has taken over the NBA
content: Players seem to be throwing the ball off the glass to themselves more than ever, and not just to generate highlights.

title: Steph and Draymond's 'last ride' comes down to Playoff Jimmy
content: Ten years after their first title, Curry and Green know Butler is the key to their pursuit of a fifth ring.

title: Can Arsenal beat PSG in Champions League?
content: Mikel Arteta needs to find a way to ensure his Arsenal side avoid being known as soccer's "Nearly Team."

title: Man United stand between Athletic and a dream Europa League final at home
content: Four teams have won a UEFA final at home. Athletic want to be No. 5. First they must beat Man United in the Europa League semis.

title: Sources: Ancelotti to coach Brazil for June games
content: The Brazil Football Federation (CBF) expects Carlo Ancelotti to be coach of the national team in time to manage a pair of CONMEBOL World Cup qualifiers in June, sources have told ESPN Brasil.

title: Martinelli open to battle as Arsenal eye striker
content: Gabriel Martinelli has suggested Arsenal need to bolster their attack this summer and welcomes the competition for places any new arrivals would bring.

title: Sources: Rüdiger out of El Clasico, doubt for CWC
content: Real Madrid defender Antonio Rüdiger is expected to be out of action for up to two months, sources have told ESPN, after undergoing knee surgery on Tuesday.

title: Luis Enrique blasts media ahead of Arsenal SF
content: Luis Enrique has hit back at what he believes is unfair negativity surrounding his Paris Saint-Germain side on the eve of their Champions League semifinal against Arsenal.

title: Players 'devastated' at Wolves' promotion snub
content: Wolves women's players have said they feel "let down" after learning the club failed to submit an application for promotion to the Championship.

title: Rugby chiefs open to Chelsea groundshare
content: The RFU would be open to ground sharing the Allianz Stadium Twickenham with Chelsea if the Premier League giants opt to redevelop Stamford Bridge.

title: Klopp congratulates Liverpool, Slot for PL win
content: Jürgen Klopp has congratulated Liverpool and his successor Arne Slot after they won the Premier League title this season.

title: Source: Villa fear Rashford out for the season
content: Villa fear Rashford could miss the rest of the season with the hamstring injury which kept him out of the FA Cup semifinal, a source has told ESPN.

title: After a disappointing weekend, the power now belongs to Shedeur Sanders
content: From here on out, all that matters for Shedeur Sanders is proving the Browns were right in selecting him.

title: Mock draft: Ja'Marr Chase goes No. 1, Ashton Jeanty in top 5
content: No surprise at No. 1, but it didn't take long for the first rookie to come off the board in our first mock.

title: The 11 most important fights of Canelo Alvarez's career
content: Nick Parkinson picks Canelo's most important boxing performances and shares his thoughts on each of them.

title: UFC 318 reactions: What would a BMF title win mean for Dustin Poirier?
content: Dustin Poirier will take on ex-featherweight champion Max Holloway one last time for the BMF title at UFC 318.

title: How Arne Slot, Liverpool won the Premier League
content: It seemed impossible to follow club legend Jurgen Klopp and win the league in his first year, but Arne Slot has done just that at Liverpool.

title: Liverpool waited 35 years for this party
content: Liverpool waited 30 years and then won the Prem during a pandemic. This time they can finally celebrate.

title: 'Suryavanshi cheering for my then team': Goenka's post goes viral
content: Sanjiv Goenka's nostalgic post featuring Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a young fan from 2017, has captivated social media. Suryavanshi, now 14, recently stunned the IPL with a record-breaking 38-ball century against Gujarat Titans. His journey, fueled by family sacrifice and relentless practice, highlights the IPL's role in showcasing India's emerging cricketing talent, marking a full-circle moment.

title: This is the 'secret' morning routine of people who live past 100
content: Life expectancy in the United States faced a decline. It is now rebounding. Many Americans aspire to live up to 100 years. Experts suggest daily habits are crucial for longevity. Early rising and hydration are important. Mindfulness and physical activity also contribute. Genetics play a role, but lifestyle choices are more impactful. Focus on controllable aspects for a longer life.

title: 22 killed in fire at restaurant in China; video shows scenes of devastation
content: A devastating fire erupted at a restaurant in Liaoyang City, northeastern China, on Tuesday, claiming the lives of 22 individuals and leaving three others injured. The blaze broke out around noon in Liaoning Province's Baita District, near the Sanlizhuang resettlement housing area. Emergency teams swiftly responded to the scene, confirming the tragic loss of life.

title: Delhi cabinet approves draft bill to regulate fees in private, govt schools
content: The Delhi government has passed a draft bill to regulate school fees across all schools, ensuring transparency and preventing arbitrary hikes. Approved by CM Rekha Gupta's cabinet, the bill addresses parents' concerns and dissolves existing School Management Committees. Fresh SMC elections are set for May 9, and complaint channels have been opened for parents to report fee-related issues.

title: After gold prices hitting Rs 1 lakh, is it time for silver to rally?
content: With the gold-to-silver ratio exceeding 100, silver is poised for a potential price surge, mirroring gold's recent rally. Experts suggest silver is undervalued and recommend it as a portfolio diversifier.

title: Man beaten to death for shouting 'Pakistan Zindabad' during cricket match
content: A man died in Mangaluru after a cricket match argument. A group of over 25 people assaulted him near Bhatra Kallurti temple. Police arrested 15 suspects, including Sachin from Kudupu. They are searching for others involved. Dakshina Kannada minister Dinesh Gundu Rao condemned the violence. He urged people to maintain peace. Police are analyzing CCTV and mobile data.

title: 16-month-old dies after water park visit: What to know about brain-eating amoeba
content: Once inside the brain, the amoeba attacks and feeds on brain tissue, shredding neurons and causing severe inflammation. It also releases enzymes and toxic molecules that break down brain cells, leading to extensive nerve damage. Even though the immune system tries to fight back infection, it can cause further brain injury

title: 'Look forward to working with you': PM Modi to Canada's Carney on election win
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has congratulated Mark Carney on his election as Canada's Prime Minister, expressing optimism for strengthened India-Canada relations. Modi highlighted shared democratic values and people-to-people ties. This comes after strained relations following Canada's accusations against India regarding the Hardeep Singh Nijjar killing.

title: ‘Be Indians first’: RSS advises Kashmiris to 'disassociate from terrorists'
content: The RSS has called on Kashmiris to actively reject terrorism and unite under a common Indian identity. Indresh Kumar criticized the Congress party for politicizing the Pahalgam terror attack and accusing Prime Minister Modi of neglecting his duties. Kumar condemned Congress's approach of criticizing the Prime Minister and undermining those working for the betterment of society.

title: One week of Pahalgam attack: 10 key developments as India-Pakistan ties hit new low
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India-Pakistan relations worsen. Firing across the LoC continues. India retaliates strongly. Anti-terror operations intensify in Kashmir. India suspends the Indus Waters Treaty and Simla Agreement. Pakistani visas are suspended. Diplomats are expelled. Pakistan proposes a neutral probe. London investigates a Pakistani diplomat's gesture towards Indian protesters. India takes strong actions against Pakistan.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: 48 tourist sites shut in Kashmir amid security concerns
content: Following a recent terror attack in Pahalgam, the Jammu and Kashmir government has reportedly closed 48 tourist destinations across the Kashmir Valley due to security concerns. While the tourism department has not officially confirmed the closures, security has been heightened in popular areas like Gulmarg and Sonamarg. The closed destinations include well-known spots such as Yusmarg, Tosamaidan and Verinag garden.

title: 'What Dhoni did for Jharkhand, Vaibhav Suryavanshi is doing it for Bihar'
content: At 12, Vaibhav Suryavanshi made his first-class debut. A year later, he hammered the fastest century in U-19 Youth Tests and bagged a lucrative IPL deal. He smoked his first ball in the IPL for a six, shed tears after getting out, and then in only his third match of the tournament, he scored a record-shattering 35-ball century - the quickest by an Indian.

title: 100 days of Donald Trump: US in a 'whirlwind'
content: Donald Trump's second presidency has seen rapid shifts in US policy within the first 100 days, impacting foreign relations, trade, and domestic affairs. Promises to end the Ukraine war and swiftly deport criminals have faced challenges, while economic policies show mixed results. The administration's fluctuating tariffs and government layoffs have raised concerns about stability and predictability.

title: Deportation of Pakistanis from India 'humanitarian concern': Mehbooba
content: Mehbooba Mufti criticized the government's decision to deport Pakistani nationals. She expressed concern for women who married Indian citizens and lived in India for decades. The government suspended visa services for Pakistanis after the Pahalgam attack. Indians in Pakistan were advised to return. Pakistanis in India were told to leave before their visas expired.

title: Women abducted even in Ramayana, says TN minister, stirs row in House
content: Tamil Nadu assembly witnessed a debate on women's safety. BJP MLA Vanathi Srinivasan compared TN to Scandinavian countries. She expressed concerns about rising crimes against women. Minister Duraimurugan referenced the Ramayana and a recent Varanasi rape case. Chief Minister M K Stalin suggested Vanathi request funds from her party. The discussion highlighted differing views on TN's safety and development.

title: Foreign investors back with $4.11 billion in Indian equities
content: Foreign investors have resumed purchasing Indian stocks, marking their longest streak since July 2023, driven by optimism surrounding potential US trade agreements and attractive valuations. Despite India-Pakistan tensions, approximately $4.11 billion has been invested across nine sessions.

title: Man ‘beaten up’ on Bhopal-Indore train for watching Pahalgam attack reel
content: A 23-year-old man was allegedly abused and assaulted by two unidentified men on the Bhopal-Indore passenger train for watching Reels about the Pahalgam terror attack. Government Railway Police filed an FIR under relevant BNS sections. The incident reportedly occurred after Dewas station. The accused are believed to be from Indore’s Chandan Nagar; investigation is underway.

title: Bengaluru teen stripped, filmed and blackmailed by social media pal & gang
content: In Bengaluru, a 16-year-old boy was allegedly targeted by a social media acquaintance and his accomplices, who stripped, filmed, and blackmailed him. The group coerced the boy into falsely confessing on video to capturing inappropriate images of girls and extorting money. The mother delayed reporting the incident, fearing for her son's safety, and suspects a female friend instigated the attack.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Pogba could join Messi in MLS move
content: D.C United are keeping tabs ahead of a possible move for free agent midfielder Paul Pogba. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: White Sox unveil Bulls-inspired first-of-its-kind City Connect uniforms
content: The latest City Connect uniform is the first on-field look that combines brand elements from MLB and the NBA.

title: Should you draft Caitlin Clark or A'ja Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: UP man shaves wife's head for protesting verbal abuse
content: In a shocking incident in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, a man identified as Ram Sagar allegedly attacked his wife, Babita, and forcibly shaved her head after she objected to his abusive language. The incident occurred on April 24 in Bada Siyur village. Babita reported the assault to police, who have registered a case against Sagar under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Kareena Kapoor's Dubai photos with Paki designer Faraz Manan go viral
content: Kareena Kapoor's pictures with Pakistani designer Faraz Manan are currently circulating online. The photos, taken in Dubai, showcase their professional relationship. Faraz Manan shared these images on his Instagram. Kareena was recently spotted at the airport, possibly en route to Dubai. The actress is seen in a linen co-ord set, enjoying dinner with Faraz.

title: Visa, international students: What Carney's Canada election win means for India
content: Mark Carney's Liberal Party is poised to form a minority government in Canada, presenting an opportunity to mend strained relations with India after a challenging period under Justin Trudeau. Carney has expressed interest in strengthening trade partnerships with India, particularly concerning the future of Indian students in Canada.

title: More layoffs! Infosys asks another batch of trainees to leave
content: Infosys has recently asked 195 more trainees to leave after they failed internal assessments, bringing the total number of affected trainees to over 800 since February. The company is offering support, including outplacement services and training programs.

title: Why Banke Bihari temple dismissed ‘boycott Muslim trade’ call
content: Following protests after the Pahalgam terror attack, right-wing groups demanded a boycott of Muslim vendors serving Vrindavan's Banke Bihari temple. However, the temple administration dismissed the call, emphasizing the significant contributions of Muslim artisans and weavers to the temple's traditions, including crafting deity attire and accessories. Local shopkeepers also expressed solidarity, highlighting the long-standing peaceful coexistence between the communities.

title: Bezos-backed startup launches $30,000 electric pickup for budget-conscious buyers
content: Slate Auto, backed by Jeff Bezos, introduces an affordable electric pickup truck priced under $30,000, potentially dropping to $20,000 with federal tax credits. This stripped-down, two-seater model targets budget-conscious buyers, aiming to revolutionize the EV market with American-made, mass-produced electric trucks starting in 2026. Its success hinges on consumer acceptance of a minimalist design and the continuation of federal incentives.

title: RG Kar victim's father says CBI presented 2 different reports in Calcutta HC
content: The father of the RG Kar Medical College victim has expressed strong distrust in the CBI, citing inconsistencies in their reports presented to different courts. He alleges the CBI is withholding crucial information about his daughter's rape and murder, despite knowing the perpetrators.

title: Aamir Khan’s ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ trailer launch postponed following Pahalgam attack
content: The trailer launch of Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' has been postponed as a mark of respect following the Pahalgam tragedy. The film is considered a spiritual successor to 'Taare Zameen Par'. Meanwhile, Khan is experiencing box office success with the re-release of 'Andaz Apna Apna', which has earned ₹1.15 crore in 3 days.

title: 'Pak' hackers deface Rajasthan govt website, claim Pahalgam attack was 'inside job'
content: The Rajasthan Education Department's website was hacked, with the homepage defaced by the "Pakistan Cyber Force." The hackers posted messages mocking India over the Abhinandan Varthaman incident and referencing the Pahalgam terror attack, claiming it was an "inside job." Authorities have taken the site offline, launched an investigation, and are auditing the system for data breaches

title: Pegasus row: SC says findings linked to national security will not be disclosed
content: The Supreme Court has decided against disclosing Pegasus reports that could compromise national security and sovereignty. While these sensitive reports will remain confidential, the court is considering informing individuals who suspect their phones were hacked. The decision aims to balance national security concerns with individual privacy rights, with the next hearing scheduled for July 30.

content: Donna Lee played the harmonica as a child in music class in the united states . in 2023, she joined the center's harmonica class, in which she practiced "the Star-Spangled Banner" she and her classmates repeatedly practiced the "star-spangled banner"

title: Home Ministry Holds High-Level Meet Amid Security Concerns After J&K Attack
content: a high-level meeting is underway in the Ministry of Home Affairs in the national capital on Tuesday . the meeting includes union home secretary Govind Mohan, director generals of border security force, assam Rifles and national security guard . this comes as security concerns intensified after the Pahalgam terror attack, which claimed 26 lives .
